goal.en: This course of three credits is designed for MS and Ph.D. students to provide advanced tropical cyclone dynamics and modeling with selected topics on research review for typhoons affecting Taiwan.

outline.ch: "This course of three credits is designed for MS and Ph.D. students, focusing on fundamental tropical cyclone dynamics and modeling. The first half of the course will be on the fundamental dynamics and governing equations and theories for tropical cyclones, and the second half will be devoted to more in-depth discussions on selected papers for simulations of typhoons/hurricanes about vortex initialization and track change by terrain effects. A special coverage is considered on the application of GPS radio occultation (RO) data to typhoon prediction. The students should be able to understand the essential dynamics, mathematic formulations and some useful theories for the tropical cyclones and acquire some knowledge about RO data assimilation."

textbook.en:
"1) Handbook- Tropical Cyclones (Y. Wang and C.-C. Wu)
2) Books – Tropical Cyclones- their Evolution, Structure and Effects (R.    A. Anthes)
– Mesoscale Dynamics (Y.-L. Lin)
– Tropical Meteorology (edited by COMET)
3) Papers related to the course"

gradMethod.en:
"1. Term paper report: Oral (20%), Written (5%)
(Term papers are based on the research of interest, basically consisting of 2-3 recent SCI papers.)
2. Final examination: Written (30%)
3. Modeling Modeling of 2-D shallow-water vortices past topography: Matlab coding, problem accuracy and completion (25%), presentation (10%)
4.      In-class discussions: Absence, Question and Answer (10%)"
